meanings.definition: To fill or pack to an excessive or overflowing degree.
meanings.sent1: She kept overcramming her suitcase until it wouldn't close.
meanings.sent2: The students overcrammed the small room with too many chairs.
meanings.sent3: He overcrammed the jar with so many marbles that it burst open!
meanings.sent4: The overflowing river overcrammed its banks after the heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The chef overcrammed the sandwich with so many ingredients that it became a messy tower.

meanings.definition: The act of studying or learning too much information in a short period of time.
meanings.sent1: Her overcramming of facts before the exam left her exhausted.
meanings.sent2: Overcramming for the test made him forget to eat dinner.
meanings.sent3: The overcramming of history dates made her brain feel like a library.
meanings.sent4: His mind felt like an overcrammed suitcase with all the new knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The overcramming of textbooks on the desk made it look like a mountain of information.
